title: POC: container2wasm integration for 64-bit support
description:
Integrate container2wasm to enable running x86_64 Docker images in the browser. This would enable native 64-bit binaries like Gemini CLI, Bun, etc.

Key steps:
1. Build AI agent Docker image (Dockerfile.ai-agent in UPGRADE_PROPOSAL.md)
2. Convert to WASM using c2w
3. Modify boot.go to load container2wasm instead of/alongside v86
4. Wire up networking via existing WebSocket bridge

Resources:
- https://github.com/ktock/container2wasm
- UPGRADE_PROPOSAL.md has detailed implementation plan
design: Replace v86 32-bit emulation with container2wasm for 64-bit Docker container support. Apptron's existing vnet WebSocket bridge should work with container2wasm's gvisor-tap-vsock networking.

title: Research: QEMU-Wasm as long-term v86 replacement
description:
Monitor QEMU-Wasm development and evaluate as potential v86 replacement.

QEMU-Wasm provides:
- Full x86_64 support
- JIT compilation (TCG backend for Wasm)
- Active development (FOSDEM 2025 presentation)

Resources:
- https://github.com/ktock/qemu-wasm
- https://ktock.github.io/qemu-wasm-demo/
- https://fosdem.org/2025/schedule/event/fosdem-2025-6290-running-qemu-inside-browser/

Track: TCI 64-bit guest support (under discussion), TCG JIT mode (under discussion)

title: Implement OAuth relay for Pro subscription support
description:
Claude Code OAuth flow fails because browser redirect can't complete in nested browser environment.

Potential solutions:
1. OAuth relay - Parent browser handles OAuth, passes token to sandbox
2. Credential bridge - Copy macOS Keychain tokens to sandbox
3. apiKeyHelper integration - Script that fetches token from parent context

This would enable Pro/Max subscription users to use Claude Code in Apptron without separate API billing.

title: Add persistent package layer
description:
Currently, apk-installed packages are lost on page reload. Add persistence for:
- /persistent/apk-cache/ synced to R2
- /persistent/node_modules/ synced to R2

Files to modify:
- worker/src/r2fs.ts - Add package cache sync
- boot.go - Mount persistent package dirs

This would eliminate re-installation time on every session.

title: Create pre-built AI agent environment bundle
description:
Create a custom Alpine bundle with AI tools pre-installed:
- nodejs, npm (Node 24)
- git, python3, pip
- zsh, tmux
- claude-code npm package
- anthropic, openai Python packages

Modify Makefile bundle targets to create bundles/ai-agent.tar.gz

This would provide instant AI-ready environment without bootstrap time.
